lines.content: Inspired by Rem from Re:Zero, below are instructions on how to use your personal assistant "Rem".
You can use Rem to add tasks to your personal checklist.
こんにちは (Konnichiwa)! Rem だよ! (I'm Rem!) :>
今日は何ができますか? (What can I do for you today?)
Below are the keywords to start your command with.
1. Type "list" to see your task checklist.
5. To stop Rem and quit the program:
* Main class to run for the Rem bot.
* @param filePath The name of path to the file used for list storage.
* Main run method for the program.
* Represents a command to add a task to the tasklist; subclass of Command.
* @param words the remaining user input after the first keyword
* @param firstWord the first word in the user input
* Executes the command for "todo", "deadline" and "event" keywords.
* This is the main way for outputting bot replies.
* @throws DukeException if the user input is unrecognised
public void execute(Storage storage, TaskList tasklist, Ui ui) throws DukeException {
+ "Please enter a task following 'todo' and I'll add it into your list. T^T\n"
// After adding new exceptions, throw them here
// After adding new exceptions, throw them here
+ "Please start your command with list, mark, unmark, todo, deadline, event or bye. :')\n"
* Represents a general command to be run in the parser; superclass of all other commands.
* This is the main way for outputting bot replies.
* @throws DukeException if the user input is unrecognised
public abstract void execute(Storage storage, TaskList tasklist, Ui ui) throws DukeException;
* Represents a command to delete a task from the tasklist; subclass of Command.
* @param words the remaining user input after the first keyword
* This is the main way for outputting bot replies.
* @throws DukeException if the user input is unrecognised
public void execute(Storage storage, TaskList tasklist, Ui ui) throws DukeException {
// Work on implementing error for "delete hello"
+ "Boo~ Don't be a quitter! I've removed this task for you. =3=\n"
+ "There's nothing in your list to delete! T^T\n"
+ "Please enter a valid task number to delete. T^T\n"
* Represents a command to exit the program; subclass of Command.
* This is the main way for outputting bot replies.
* @throws DukeException if the user input is unrecognised
public void execute(Storage storage, TaskList tasklist, Ui ui) throws DukeException {
* Represents a command to find tasks containing the keyword; subclass of Command.
* @param words the remaining user input after the first keyword
* This is the main way for outputting bot replies.
public void execute(Storage storage, TaskList tasklist, Ui ui) {
+ "These are the tasks you are searching for ^3^:\n"
* Represents a command to output unrecognised user inputs; subclass of Command.
* Executes the command for unrecognised user inputs.
* This is the main way for outputting bot replies.
public void execute(Storage storage, TaskList tasklist, Ui ui) {
+ "Please start your command with list, mark, unmark, todo, deadline, event or bye. :')\n"
* Represents a command to output the users' list; subclass of Command.
* @param words the remaining user input after the first keyword
* This is the main way for outputting bot replies.
* @throws DukeException if the user input is unrecognised
public void execute(Storage storage, TaskList tasklist, Ui ui) throws DukeException {
+ "Please only enter 'list' to view your list. T^T\n"
* Represents a command to mark or unmark a task; subclass of Command.
* @param words the remaining user input after the first keyword
* @param firstWord the first word in the user input
* This is the main way for outputting bot replies
* @throws DukeException if the user input is unrecognised
public void execute(Storage storage, TaskList tasklist, Ui ui) throws DukeException {
// Work on implementing error for empty mark argument
+ "There's nothing in your list to mark! T^T\n"
+ "Please enter a valid task number to mark. T^T\n"
// Work on implementing error for empty unmark argument
+ "There's nothing in your list to unmark! T^T\n"
+ "Please enter a valid task number to unmark. T^T\n"
+ "Please start your command with list, mark, unmark, todo, deadline, event or bye. :')\n"
* Constructs a new exception with the specified detail message.
* @param message the error message to be printed out
* Class to parse user input and return the suitable commands to run.
* Parses the given user's string of command input and
* @param input the user input to parse
* @throws DukeException if the command is unrecognised
public static Command parse(String input) throws DukeException {
* Represents a storage object that deals with loading the tasklist from the txt file
* and storing the tasklist to the file.
* @param filePath the path of the txt file to be used for storing list
* Reads the txt file line by line for each task
* and returns an ArrayList of all the tasks in the file.
* @return an ArrayList of all the tasks in the file
// If file is empty, return empty ArrayList
// Defensive coding for the case of errors in the starting letters
* Writes the reformatted ArrayList of tasks to the txt file.
* @param tasklist the reformatted ArrayList of tasks to be written to the txt file
public void writeToFile(TaskList tasklist) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("Failed to write to file!");
* Represents a Deadline task; subclass of a Task.
* @param taskName the name of the deadline task
* @param deadline the deadline of the task
* Returns a reformatted string of the task to be stored in the text file.
* @return Reformatted string representation of the task
* Returns a string of the task (eg.: [D][ ] return book (by: June 6th) ).
* Represents an Event task; subclass of a Task.
* @param taskName the name of the event task
* @param event the event of the task
* Returns a reformatted string of the task to be stored in the text file.
* @return Reformatted string representation of the task
* Returns a string of the task (eg.: [E][ ] project meeting (at: Aug 6th 2-4pm) ).
* @param taskName the name of the task
* Returns a string of tick or empty string depending on whether the task is done or not.
* @return String representation of a tick or empty string
* Empty formatTask function to be overridden by subclasses.
* Returns String of the task name (eg. [ ] read book).
* @return String representation of the task name
* Represents a Todo task; subclass of a Task.
* @param taskName the name of the todo task
* Returns a reformatted string of the task to be stored in the text file.
* @return Reformatted string representation of the task
* Returns a string of the task (eg.: [T][ ] read book).
* Represents the user interface of the Duke program.
public static final String WELCOME = "Konnichiwa! I'm Rem desu! :>\n"
+ "What can I do for you today?\n";
public static final String GOODBYE = "See you soon! <3";
* Prints the starting message when bot is launched.
* Prints the goodbye message when bot is terminated.
* Prints the error message when an error occurs.
* @param error the error message to be printed
* Reads the string of command from the user before hitting 'enter' key.
* @return the string of command entered by the user before hitting 'enter' key
* @param tasks arraylist of tasks already in the list
* Constructor for the TaskList class, for an empty tasklist.
* Adds a task to the list.
* Deletes a task from the list.
* @param taskNum the index of task to be deleted
* Returns formatted list of tasks in the tasklist in String format.
* @return the formatted list of tasks in the tasklist in String format
* Returns the entire string of a single task in the tasklist (eg. [T][ ] read book).
* @param idx index of the task in the tasklist
* @return the entire string of a single task in the tasklist
